titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania. LJS 310: Map of district in Tarn-et-Garonne

notesStmt.note: Title supplied by cataloger (viewed on 17 September 2013).
Dimensions of original manuscript: 630 x 700 mm.

msContents.summary: Manuscript map in color on parchment of a district in the southwestern department of Tarn-et-Garonne, between Castelsarrasin, Castelferrus, and the Cistercian monastery of Belleperche, possibly to illustrate water rights between Castelferrus and Castelsarrasin. The Garonne River is depicted with bridges, mill, sandbanks, and ferry points. Buildings are illustrated in some detail and labeled by a contemporary hand. Probably made in Castelferrus. Creased by past folds, now framed under glass.

history.provenance: Originally owned by Jean Rollet, seigneur de Castelferrus.
Appears in Simon Finch's cat. 8 (1991), no. 68.
Formerly owned by a Swiss collector; sold via Sam Fogg Ltd. (London) to Lawrence J. Schoenberg, July 1999.
